Disposal of the CCGS Hudson

F7044-220442/A
Major, Andrea
Telephone No. - (403) 796-3230 

The Canadian Coast Guard (CCG) has a requirement to dispose of, through Ship Breaking, the CCGS Hudson. The Contractor will be required to prepare the vessel for transportation, transport the vessel to the Approved Site and subsequently break (dismantle and dispose or recycle) the vessel in an efficient and environmentally responsible manner in accordance with the Statement of Work - Annex A.

The Contractor will have until December 15, 2022 to remove the vessel from the Bedford Institute of Oceanography (BIO) in Dartmouth, Nova Scotia, and until November 15, 2023 to complete the Work.

The Basel Convention on the Control of Transboundary Movements of Hazardous Wastes and their Disposal applied to this requirement.

There is a mandatory vessel viewing associated with this requirement. The viewing will held on September 8, 2022 at the Bedford Institute of Oceanography (BIO) in Dartmouth, Nova Scotia, where the vessel is currently docked. See Part 2, article 2.5 for additional information. 

Delivery Date: Above-mentioned

The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.

Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.

### Tender Details
- **Publication Date**: 2022-08-26
- **Tender Closing Date**: 2022-10-13 T14:00:00
- **Amendment Date**: 2022-10-07

### Regulation and Trade Agreements
This procurement is governed by the following trade agreements:
- Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
- World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
- Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
- Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
- Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)
- Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
- Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement (Canada-UK TCA)
- Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
- Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)

### Invitation to Bid
All interested suppliers are invited to submit a bid.

### Specifications of Requirements
The Canadian Coast Guard has a requirement to dispose of the CCGS Hudson, a vessel requiring dismantling and recycling. The Contractor will be required to:
- Prepare the vessel for transportation
- Transport the vessel to a designated Site
- Break (dismantle and dispose or recycle) the vessel in an environmentally responsible manner
- Comply with the Statement of Work - Annex A

### Timeline
The Contractor must remove the vessel from the Bedford Institute of Oceanography (BIO) in Dartmouth, Nova Scotia, by December 15, 2022, and complete the Work by November 15, 2023.

### Mandatory Vessel Viewing
A mandatory vessel viewing will take place on September 8, 2022, at the Bedford Institute of Oceanography (BIO) in Dartmouth, Nova Scotia. Please see Part 2, article 2.5 for details.

### Delivery Date
The Delivery Date is specified above.

### Languages of Document Submission
Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.

### Contracting Entity
The contracting entity is Public Works and Government Services Canada.
